channel.title: [RSPoser] Annoying RSPoser BS
channel.description:
Ok in able to add a weapon to your "kojack" model, you need to merge the item using metasequoia. So, i go ahead and do that with the staff of light by getting the kojack model and making it from a DAT file to a MQO file (with DATmaker) then i merged the staff like so...
[img]http://i44.tinypic.com/t8rz10.jpg[/img]
after i merged it and make it back into a DAT file, then i open the model, and get this.
[img]http://i43.tinypic.com/xujqg.jpgimg[/img]
So then i click "open anim file" and open it as an anim file. The model will show up, but i couldnt animate it. So then i click on "open anim file" again and i click "animation". Then the proper numbers came up for when u want to rotate something. then i start switching it around, then i click 5 (which is his neck) and i tried rotating its y axis...but i noticed the dot didnt move. but i tried rotating anyways, but nothing? Anyone who has any experience with RSPoser know what im doing wrong?
-NOTE- plz do not ask where i got the software for rsposer...im trying to get help, not give out links

item.title: [RSPoser] Annoying RSPoser BS
item.dc:creator: @nwe_luigi2 nwe luigi2
item.description:
@nwe_luigi2 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:12, topic:334198”][quote author=nwe luigi2 link=topic=430597.msg3164649#msg3164649 date=1269904054]

If you cannot make a MQOv2, then you need to get the newer version of DatMaker. The new one that, as i was told, SilentCJ helped with, can convert it to a MQOv2. I have a copy of it, but dont ask me to upload.

whats the difference between MQO and MQOv2?
[/quote]

The file-type has no difference at all. The actual difference is that v2, is exported with the animations. Regular MQO is not, it is only the model itself.[/quote]

wow thanks a lot! i finally can make decent kojak models now

Read full topic

item.title: [RSPoser] Annoying RSPoser BS
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“nwe luigi2, post:11, topic:334198”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=430597.msg3164603#msg3164603 date=1269901324]
If you cannot make a MQOv2, then you need to get the newer version of DatMaker. The new one that, as i was told, SilentCJ helped with, can convert it to a MQOv2. I have a copy of it, but dont ask me to upload.
[/quote]
whats the difference between MQO and MQOv2?[/quote]

The file-type has no difference at all. The actual difference is that v2, is exported with the animations. Regular MQO is not, it is only the model itself.

Read full topic

item.title: [RSPoser] Annoying RSPoser BS
item.dc:creator: @mongoth666 mongoth666
item.description:
@mongoth666 wrote:

[quote=“MrPotatoHead, post:6, topic:334198”]Poser has always had some custom model problems, found a fix on some models of loading the animation BEFORE the model, but sometimes they still refuse to load.
Zip the model, upload and pm me a link, i’ll take a quick look.[/quote]

Alrighty, im on it

CoonHunter:

Does the model still have its animation intact? Im going to guess not. You using datmaker and the original kojak model, and an animated form of the staff. Export the model from .dat to .mqo v2. If you just export as a regular .mqo it will not keep its animation. Then you can combine the models you want into it.

It wont let me make it a MQOv2.

Read full topic

item.title: [RSPoser] Annoying RSPoser BS
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Does the model still have its animation intact? Im going to guess not. You using datmaker and the original kojak model, and an animated form of the staff. Export the model from .dat to .mqo v2. If you just export as a regular .mqo it will not keep its animation. Then you can combine the models you want into it.

item.title: [RSPoser] Annoying RSPoser BS
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Poser has always had some custom model problems, found a fix on some models of loading the animation BEFORE the model, but sometimes they still refuse to load.
Zip the model, upload and pm me a link, i’ll take a quick look.

Read full topic

item.title: [RSPoser] Annoying RSPoser BS
item.dc:creator: @mongoth666 mongoth666
item.description:
@mongoth666 wrote:

EDIT: i do hav a generic animation file. Im trying to say that when i select the number, (ex) 5. Which is his neck, the white dot wont move…

this is probably because i opened this model as a anim file with a generic animation file. I did this becuase it will only project the model if i open it as a anim file. Because when i try to open it as a model, i get that blasted violation error.

ALL MODELS THAT COME CLEAN OUT OF METASEQUOIA, AND TRY TO LOAD THE MODEL AS A MODEL, IT REJECTS IT!

here is a pic of the dot not cooperating (its a bit sloppy)

2ylv19i.jpg900×584

Read full topic

item.title: [RSPoser] Annoying RSPoser BS
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

You don’t have an animation file loaded… simple as that.
Looks like you have a model merged and loaded correctly but no animation file.
The error occurs when you try to animate something without an animation file loaded.
So you tried loading the model as an animation file which sometimes does work… ooops, but nothing will animate because it’s a model file and not an animation file.
There is a generic animation file somewhere out there.

Read full topic

item.title: [RSPoser] Annoying RSPoser BS
item.dc:creator: @mongoth666 mongoth666
item.description:
@mongoth666 wrote:

EDIT: thought u said export. How do u import… >_>

item.title: [RSPoser] Annoying RSPoser BS
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

You don’t make the two as one object. And you don’t import weapons on Rsposer. You import the kojack model and the anim file

Read full topic
